alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHEASTERN LEWIS COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 243 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking clusters of strong drenching thunderstorms across northern parts of Jefferson and Lewis counties, including the Thousands Islands region. While the storms are generally moving east southeast at 35 mph, they have tended to train over the same area. This has resulted in some areas picking up multiple inches of rain since lunchtime. HAZARD...Very heavy rain and wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Drum, Clayton, Wellesley Island State Park, Redwood, Kring Point State Park, Philadelphia, Alexandria Bay, Theresa, Antwerp, Harrisville, Grindstone, Soft Maple Reservoir, Fishers Landing, La Fargeville, Diana Center, Oxbow, Muskellunge Lake, Lake Bonaparte, and Indian River. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 49 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
